Posted By: Progle (8/9/2011 4:38:27 PM)
Rating:

@Caitiebug

It's what's known as a may ability. If you declare your combat phase and then attack with this guy, you MAY tap a red and X other mana to fireball for that much either at another player, or a creature.

This is indeed a bomb. He really helped me out at FNM the other night. My opponent went from 20 to about 8 all in one fell swoop. It was all she wrote after that.

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (8/27/2011 5:47:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: At first glance I didn't think was a very effective card. Then I got it out. It kicks so much to the curb. Even if he's blocked, you can (by the time you have +6 mana) kill creatures or target your opponent or a planeswalker and do a lot of damage. Great in Green/Red, and I surprisingly run mine in a RUG deck. Tons of fun for a creature card. A 5/5 flier for 6 is already okay with me, then the ability just kicks it into overdrive.
posts.html:

Posted By: BluthBanana (8/24/2011 1:17:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) on legs, except for the divide damage effect (which, by the way, I've never seen anyone using)). It's cool. I've got a foil one, shame I haven't got to play it yet.
  
Not sure of what to say about it. It really is a bomb, without being broken. Being able to turn all extra mana into damage late game when you're top decking is awesome, specially when strapped to a 5/5 dragon. However, I keep myself from putting creatures with cmc over 4 in my red deck because I know I never get to play them. Could be better in a multicolored deck, though.
posts.html:
